means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯塔克绰号，大块头，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“干草垛”(haystack)

sentence.Network_en: He ordered them to stack up pillows behind his back.
sentence.Network_cn: 他命令他们把几个枕头叠放在自己的背后。

sentence.Network_en: They said they were going to stack the court with anti-abortion judges.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们说将会往法院中安排一些反对堕胎的法官。

sentence.Network_en: A stack of files awaited me on my desk.
sentence.Network_cn: 我桌上有一堆文件正待我去处理。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 见 pile 条 pile arms

phrase.cizu_name: stack up( 或 stack something up)

jx.jx_en_mean: form or cause to form a large quantity; build up

lj.lj_ly: cars stack up behind every bus, while passengers queue to pay fares.
lj.lj_ls: 在乘客排队买车票时，每一辆公共汽车后面的小汽车都排成了长队。

lj.lj_ly: our rural schools stack up well against their urban counterparts.
lj.lj_ls: 我们的乡村学校完全可以比得上城里的同类学校。

lj.lj_ly: Their gift doesn't stack up against his.
lj.lj_ls: 他们的礼品比不上他送的

lj.lj_ly: Her report just doesn't stack up.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse stakkr 'haystack', of Germanic origin

entry.def: A stack of things is a pile of them.

example.ex: There were stacks of books on the bedside table and floor.
example.tran: 床头桌和地板上有几摞书。

entry.def: If you stack a number of things, you arrange them in neat piles.

example.ex: Mme Cathiard was stacking the clean bottles in crates...
example.tran: 凯西亚德夫人正在将干净的瓶子整齐地码放在板条箱里。

example.ex: They are stacked neatly in piles of three.
example.tran: 它们每 3 个一组被整齐地码放在一起。

entry.def: If you say that someone has stacks of something, you mean that they have a lot of it.

example.ex: If the job's that good, you'll have stacks of money.
example.tran: 如果这个工作真有那么好，你将会赚很多钱。

entry.tran: 在(某组织机构中)安插(对自己有利的人员)
entry.def: If someone in authority stacks an organization or body, they fill it with their own supporters so that the decisions it makes will be the ones they want it to make.

example.ex: They said they were going to stack the court with anti-abortion judges...
example.tran: 他们说将会往法院中安排一些反对堕胎的法官。

example.ex: The committee is stacked with members from energy-producing states.
example.tran: 该委员会中安插进了几位来自能源生产州的成员。

entry.def: If you say that the odds are stacked against someone, or that particular factors are stacked against them, you mean that they are unlikely to succeed in what they want to do because the conditions are not favourable.

example.ex: The odds are stacked against civilians getting a fair trial...
example.tran: 平民难以得到公正的审判。

example.ex: Everything seems to be stacked against us.
example.tran: 一切好像都对我们不利。

means.word_mean: 2. (often followed by `of') a large number or amount or extent;

sentences.sentence: "he made a mint on the stock market"

means.word_mean: 3. a list in which the next item to be removed is the item most recently stored (LIFO)
4. a large tall chimney through which combustion gases and smoke can be evacuated
5. a storage device that handles data so that the next item to be retrieved is the item most recently stored (LIFO)

sentences.sentence: "stack your books up on the shelves"

means.word_mean: 3. arrange the order of so as to increase one's winning chances;

Sentence.sentence: Even if the odds are stacked against you, marriage can more than compensate.
Stacked near the checkout counters, and as colorful as a Fisher-Price toy, is a not-so-serious-looking power tool: a battery-operated saw-and-drill combination.
The stack of congressional regulations governing federal student grants and loans now stands twice as tall as I do.

sentences.en: They are specially packaged so that they stack easily.
sentences.cn: 它们经过特别包装以便于堆放。

sentences.en: The whole garden was stacked with bricks.
There's a whole stack of bills waiting to be paid.

jushi.english: They are specially packaged so that they stack easily.
jushi.chinese: 它们经过特别包装,以便于堆放。

jushi.english: He stacked the firewood in the backyard.
The whole garden was stacked with bricks.
